Some minor notes :

"Wheels" were well known in Egypt at the time, but they were never half as practical as "sledges" for moving big objects exceeding a certain density.

"Zallaga" _(the Egyptian word for "Sledge" & wherefrom the latter originates linguistically) _ means slippery in the sense of viscosity (like a snail emerged in its own mucus), not in the sense of surface smoothness (like silk).

In the tableau you featured, you'll find that the man with the jar is actually pouring a mixture of natural Mucins (from various plant & animal sources) whereby he's creating a "Gel-track" under the rails ..[ like a giant snail/tank :) ]

The the other guy who is clapping on the top is actually the "coxswain" of the 4 puller-teams. He's responsible for coordinating the 4 alternating discrete pulls in a cyclic rotation. ( like a 4-cylinder engine :)
He must insure that the sledge never stops to a halt, all the way until the lay-down site.
_ [ it is crucial to keep moving within the comforts of "Dynamic Friction" to avoid burnouts in both Man-power & Mucin under "Static Friction" ... one could only imagine the colossal heat generated by a 1st nudge to such a Gigantor _ :)

I believe specifically the Giza pyramids were built 1 or 2 ice ages ago, which can be as old as 12,500 to 30 thousand years. There is no carbon dating to determine this, but there is water erosion evidence on the sphinx. The amount of rain it would need to give it the erosion it shows puts it in a different time, with a different climate. The granite stones in the pyramid cannot be cut to that precision with any type of copper chisel, regardless of how much time you invest. There was no evidence of any tombs or bodies, it was completely sealed up as if by design. There are some inconspicuous writings about Khufu above the "Kings" chamber by the huge granite columns, but some people say that this was forged by the first explorer into the great pyramid to legitimize his funding. Every part of this pyramid when studied from a mechanics standpoint show it being a reactor or some type of power plant. Each "shaft" in the "Queen" chamber shows evidence of zinc oxide and an acid type for the 2nd shaft. What was found all over the room on the walls they theorized was the result of combustion, but was cleaned away. Each shaft had metallic diode like connectors when explored by the German scientists in the 90s. Christopher Dunn's book "The Giza Power Plant" states this union of chemicals would form hydrogen gas and would travel up the grand gallery while getting amplified by a multitude of resonators while leading to Kings chamber. Inside there what happened is a mystery, but he believes the energy was amplified even more and directed out the shafts in those rooms which lead to the outside air. The shafts have been verified to be like tuned tubes, like what are used for microwave waveguides. Something else he doesn't mention is that the construction of the pyramid is like an insulated circuit would be. Highly conductive stones on the inside (red granite) with an outdoor limestone, and the white limestone casing which had very little conductive properties. It will take your mind on a ride because it makes more sense than the conventional argument. One thing I'm sure of though: these pyramids were NOT built in the time period they state, and not by the Egyptian people. I believe they merely settled there seeing this land as divine. People like Zawass and other egyptologists fight back vehemently against any other view because they think it threatens their careers. Partially it would make them seem stupid. This is the problem. Who knows who built them maybe mythological Atlantis, or the ones whom created us, possibly travelers from another star system.

The copper saws as the cutting tools hypothesis is pretty flimsy. Firstly we have never found a single Egyptian copper saw big enough to cut a single block. When people have actually tried cutting these blocks with copper saws, water and sand it takes days to cut an inch. The cuts are also unbelievably precise - you can observe this inside the pyramids themselves when you see the rocks perfectly flush with each other. Copper swords cutting with sand cannot achieve this precision.
We also have to remember that to build the Giza pyramid in the suggested 20year timespan a block has to be cut, positioned perfectly every 5mins, 24 hours a day for 20 years. The sides of the Giza pyramid are aligned as precisely as our modern laser guided methods produce. Been there and it's breathtaking. That said a few researchers have discovered some things that might finally shed light on the matter :

Stones are artificial similar to Joseph Davidovitz' process. If you go to the Valley of the Noble in the tomb of Rekhmire you see that process drawn on the left wall, I've seen it myself. That explanation doesn't require wacky aliens or lost civilization tech but does credit the builders with much more knowledge than we do, it's the best explanation to account for the erratic shapes of the blocks and the way they're assembled perfectly with no cement, that goes double for the temple of the Sphinx where we find stones up to 500 tons perfectly assembled despite their shapes that defy logic. You find visual proof of that on certain blocks on the ground level of the Great Pyramid on which we see "lips" like the kind we get when some liquid mixture escapes a mold before hardening. We can also see mold prints on blocks above 50m where the sandy winds don't reach and couldn't polish the blocks. That also explains how they managed to perfectly line up those 70 tons granite blocks inside the "king's chamber" lifted about 70m above the ground (which we'd be hardly capable of even with cranes). And if that wasn't enough did you take a look at the blocks that fell in the sand ? I found a granite block between Khephren and Mykerinos pyramid and struck it with a stone, it broke quite easily the inside was some mixture of sand that was quite brittle to the touch, definitely not granite.

If we really want to know how these wonders were built we gotta take the subject off of the egyptologists who're only good at reading papyruses and finally let engineers, architects, stone cutters etc have a go.

A russian team (Fomenko and Nosovsky) managed to get samples to analyse back home and they confirmed that the chemical composition of the limestone wasn't natural but also presented a huge amount of fibers we don't find in natural stone. Davidovitz also did that back in the 80s and was only told "this isn't possible", no double check, no science, just blind dogmatism...

How did they move the stones?
Theoretically they could have put each stone on a sled and pulled that sled with hundreds of people, but that would be very labor intensive.
I believe they rather lined up the stones in one big row from the quarry all the way to the pyramid. On top of each stone there would be a couple of people operating a big lever, with which they could push the stone ahead forward for maybe 10 centimeter. Then they would lift the lever while the crew behind them pushed their stone forward, then they'd put force on the lever to prevent the stone ahead from sliding back while the crew on that stone was pushing the stone ahead of them forward.
These 3 steps would repeat in quick succession, making the whole row of stones crawl forward at maybe a meter per minute., adding a stone to the pyramid every couple of minutes.

Moving heavy objects is relatively easy if you have a lever and something to brace the lever against, and what could be better to brace the lever against than the next stone?
I would not be surprised if this technique had been used to construct all the large stone structures in the past, like Hadrian's wall, Jeruzalem's temple mond, Stonehenge, the statues of Easter Island and the hunebeds in the east of the Netherlands.

The pyramid of Giza actually has 8 visible sides not 4 like most people think, they are concave on each face and can only be seen from above on the equinox. This is because the pyramids were used to indicate solstices and equinoxes. The pyramid is located at 29 degrees, 58 minutes, 51.06 seconds north latitude, and 31 degrees, 9 minutes, and 0.0 seconds east longitude. It marks the Spring Equinox due to the angle of the sides of the pyramid vs. its latitude, it casts no shadow at noon during the spring equinox. The Great Pyramid of Giza is aligned True North by being the most accurately aligned structure in existence and faces true north with only 3/60th of a degree of error. The position of the North Pole moves over time and the pyramid was probably exactly aligned at one time. Also The Great Pyramid is located at the center of the landing mass of the earth. The east/west parallel that crosses the most land and the north/south meridian that crosses the most land intersect in two places on the earth, one in the ocean and the other at the Great Pyramid. The Great Pyramid is encoded with the distance to the Sun. The Sun’s Parallax: The size of the earth as viewed from the Sun and expressed as an angle and generally taken to be ½ the diameter at the equator (Solar Equatorial Parallax) is 8.9008091 seconds of arc using 91848,817 miles as the mean distance to the sun and 3,963.4914 miles as the equatorial radius. The distance between the mean socket level and the height of the leveled bedrock is 8.9008 Pyramid Inches. The Pyramid also tell the Tropical Year or Calendar Year by the length of a base side being 9131 pyramid inches measured at the mean socket level, or 365.24 pyramid cubits, which is the number of days in a year. {9131/25 = 365.24, accurate to 5 digits} same with the Tropical Year; The perimeter of the base divided by 100 = 365.24, the number of days in a year. {9131 PI * 4 / 100, accurate to 5 digits} and The length of the Antechamber used as the diameter of a circle produces a circumference of 365.242. {accurate to 6 digits} AND The length of the granite portion of the floor of the antechamber to the King's Chamber times 2*sqrt(Pi) = 365.242 as well as The ratio of the lengths of the Grand Gallery to the solid diagonal of the King's Chamber times 100 equals the number of days in a tropical year. {(1881.5985600 / 51.516461) * 100 = 365.242200, accurate to 8 digits. It also tells the mean distance to the Sun;
The height of the pyramid times 10*9 = avg. distance to sun. {5813.2355653 * 10**9 * (1 mi / 63291.58 PI) = 91,848,500 mi} Mean Distance to the Sun: Half of the length of the diagonal of the base times 10**6 = average distance to the sun Mean Distance to Sun: The height of the pyramid times 10**9 represents the mean radius of the earth's orbit around the sun, or Astronomical Unit. { 5813.235565376 pyramid inches x 10**9 = 91,848,816.9 miles} Mean Distance to Moon: ] The length of the Jubilee passage times 7 times 10**7 is the mean distance to the moon. {215.973053 PI * 7 * 10**7 =1.5118e10 PI = 238,865 miles } It also tells the Sun's Radius: Twice the perimeter of the bottom of the granite coffer times 10**8 is the sun's mean radius. { 270.45378502 PI 10**8 = 427,316 miles} the Earth's Polar Radius: The sacred cubit times 10**7 = polar radius of the earth (distance from North Pole to Earth's center) {25 PI * 10**7 * (1.001081 in / 1 PI) * (1 ft / 12 in) * (1 mi/ 5280 ft) = 3950 miles } the Radius of the Earth: The curvature designed into the faces of the pyramid exactly matches the radius of the earth.

He has no idea, and any idea he does have is wrong, since he is following the uninformed lead of mainstream archaeologists, who are not engineers. Besides the pyramids, there are abundant examples of high level engineering and precision machining on both small and massive industrial scales, in granite, diorite and other extremely hard materials, all over Egypt. When viewed as a whole, this body of work gives the powerful impression of having been easy, routine, not difficult. The idea of brute force labor and copper tools is one that engineers who visit Egypt laugh at, before they begin speculating in engineering terms on how these works could have been designed and manufactured. The dolerite pounders idea of quarrying granite is idiotic and has been conclusively debunked by Christopher Dunn and others. It quite simply is impossible. For example, you cannot hold onto a dolorite ball while striking granite for very long, because the impact shock will be transmitted into your hand, and injure it fairly quickly. So you need to let go shortly before impact, at which point the ball can take off in a random direction. Similarly, if you use the pounders as scrapers, you can remove even less material. Furthermore, the Unfinished Obelisk is deeply undercut. Nobody can explain how diorite pounders could have been used to cut sideways in that fashion. Again, impossible. There are square holes in the trench with sharp corners. How they could have been cut with ball-shaped pounders is unknown. This guy is very good when he is within areas of proven expertise, but in Egypt he is definitely out of his lane. His method is to appeal to expert authority, which works in many areas of science, but in Egypt, the so-called experts have less credibility by the day, while engineers and others with technical backgrounds discuss the tools and methods that were absolutely necessary to perform the work. Archaeologists insist that steel was never used, because steel tools have not been found, yet, if their dating is wrong, and if the ancient works are far older, on the order of 10,000 plus years, as both geologists and oral traditions agree, then the chances of finding remnant tools becomes vanishingly small. The more plausible story is that the dynastic Egyptians inherited these works, and claimed them as their own. We see much the same in ancient Peru, where multiton, polygonal megalithic stonework joined with virtually airtight precision has been attributed to the Inca, much of whose own demonstrated work is far inferior, and where once again, ancient oral traditions speak of inheritance of the sites.

Thoughts anyone on the idea that the stones were actually cast in place where they are at, as in the necessary elements poured into a mold? It would explain so much: transporting such massive weight hundreds of miles across the desert, getting the massive stones to such elevations, and cutting them and placing them together with such precision. If they were cast in place using limestone, the same way that we use pour concrete mix into molds to make concrete walls, blocks, and so forth, it would make things SO much easier.
This idea was proposed in the 1950s I believe, but the more 'reputable' scientists of the day quickly dismissed the idea, and we've been taught many other theories in school ever since. I imagine they would have been quick to dismiss the idea probably for the fact that they didn't think of it themselves and because their ideas which seem far-fetched had already gained such traction. If this idea prevailed, it would hurt their reputations.
That's the story I've heard anyways. It seems to me that this seems like one of the most plausible scenarios. I'm not a huge historian, so there may be things I'm missing or unaware of, but that's why I'm asking for input.

I just figured out how the pyramids were built, Its a simple matter of block stacking starting with two blocks side by side, one block is flipped up on the other, the base is then surrounded with a further eight blocks a ninth block is flipped up on the lowest level of blocks then again making a total of three central blocks one on top of another. Then eight blocks can be flipped up on top of the base eight blocks, stacking those into twos, then the base is surrounded by a a further sixteen blocks. At this point you have a perfect three tierd pyramid. If you follow this exact principle you will eventually get a pyramid as grand as Gizaz. At some point in the stacking method room can be made for ramps, rooms and tunnels.

As the pyramid got higher and higher, the sand was carried up and added to the pile, increasing its height. Derek, I know this is an old video, but I may have a theory about how the pyramids were created. I have no experience in engineering, but check this out. Of course, you know that the Nile is nearby. Now imagine digging a square hole the height of the pyramids.  Now with the Nile, you divert water to the hole, the stone and then can be lowered into the hole. Fill the inner gap with gravel, and once it is in, you lower the second layer of stone. You then pour the sediment on the inside and then on the outside. From there, you work your way up to the capstone. Remove the inner soil, then remove the dirt from the outside of the pyramid. So instead of working your way upward, you work your way downwards. Since Giza is on a hill, it would be easier to remove the outer hill than to build straight up.

This video is either a hoax or a joke (or both). To suggest that granite can be cut out in 70 tone blocks by hitting them repeatedly with 'other stones' is just dumb. One needs a sharp tool harder than stone to cut a stone. '5 mm per hour' he says... You try for a whole day and lets see how much progress you make.
1) 30 years to build it with 2 million stones: 'A stone every 3 minutes', he says, without even laughing, as if that is actually possible.
2) Both pyramids and the sphinx were built about 10,000 years ago, much earlier than the pharaohs.
3) Current population of Egypt is not direct descendant from the population at the time of the Pharaohs, in the same way that current Greeks are not descendants of Plato or Archimedes.
4) Pyramids are not tombs, but they were used as tombs. That is a different matter. Even the Pharaohs would not spend all the resources available in their country to build nonsensical stone towers that require at least 100 years to build... with no practical use.

I certainly don't believe aliens or giants did this, but it is fascinating that there doesn't seem to be a great consensus on exactly how this was achieved. The numbers just seem inconceivable to me. The quarrying alone is astonishing. Then there's the transportation problem. And finally, putting it all together. And somehow they had the infrastructure and manpower to do this for 30 years, a stone every three minutes. Unreal.

I know there's a lot of debate online just regarding the quarrying. Some say that copper with an abrasive is just too time consuming to be realistic for this volume of work. Some make the same claim for bashing away one rock on another. 1mm per hour?

I guess if you have enough people, you can brute force just about anything, but man that's a lot of work! Can you imagine being one of the workers? You start a quarrying job and thirty years later, you're doing the EXACT same thing all day, every day.

A note from the future: In 2017, research on the Great Pyramid using new muon detectors discovered previously unknown voids that clarified that the "Grand Gallery" was in fact the counterweight track for a huge elevator that was used to lift blocks to the upper levels. The pyramid was built in a spiral, with the height of each layer dictated by the length of the ramp that could be wrapped around what would eventually be the pyramid's outer edge. Once the layer was complete, it formed a plateau that the subsequent layer would be built on, and the previous wraparound ramp was filled in with the finished surface stones!

The pyramids were built hundreds of thousands of years ago. the Egyptian's  did not build them no way.

Although we can never be certain exactly how they were built, we can often say with some certainty how they were NOT built. He unthinkingly makes the assumption that stones were " floated down on rafts ". If you try this you quickly find that it does not work, since the heavy stone will flip the barge over so that the stone hangs beneath the float, or sinks if the barge has insufficient built in buoyancy. If you remember what Archimedes told us, you will realize that a submerged stone is subject to a buoyancy force which reduces its apparent weight, so if a waterway is available it makes sense to move submerged stones wit attached buoyancy.
Another assumption which is almost always made is that ramps were used. Moving a stone up a ramp is not easy. It's easier to use leverage and flip a cuboidal stone over another stone like it already in place.
Another assumption made that always struck me as being highly simplistic is that the labour force were slaves, and were directed by priests. Yeah right !

What if the blocks were moulded like we make bricks? You would only need to move the mould into place and pour in the brick solution, then once it is dry move it to the next place. Thus not needing to even move a stone at all.

The sarcophagus in the 'Kings Chamber' was hollowed out at a rate we can only just manage today using sonic drilling techniques. The deep, rather than shallow, spiral marks left by their tools show how quickly the cutting tool was able to drill through the granite. This is simple, obvious. evidence that the pyramid builders had advanced (at least by our standard) technology. Similarly there are many ancient Egyptian diorite vases that defy explanation. Diorite is too hard to hollow out by copper. In the Serapeum of Saqqara there are 100 ton stone coffin-like boxes in locations that we couldn't place them today. They show signs of being polished using liquid  but not acid. The more you learn about ancient Egypt and the phenomenal feats of engineering they achieved the more stupid people sound when they tell you how primitive their tools were. The way they built it was much more mundane. You're saying yourself that a stone was set every 3 minutes. Assuming you need 30, 40 or 50 men for a single stone, how would you imagine this using a single ramp? Also, why would they use big stones rather than small ones if this wasn't visible from the outside once the pyramid was finished? Why was the big pyramid steeper than others? I would assume this was all out of practical reasons. They simply attached ropes to those stones. The rope then went up the pyramid to a log, and redirected down again. The workers walked up the pyramid (gaining potential energy), then pulled down the ropes, which pulled up the stones. The stones were chosen as large as possible to maximize efficiency. Too small and you're wasting space and workers, too large and it gets impossible logistically. The blocks were 2 tons or so, and so 50 or 60 heavy workers could pull the blocks up by walking down. It doesn't seem particularly far fetched. You could easily imagine someone with a rope, throwing it over a branch of a tree and pulling on it. They did also find a mechanism to shut the king's chamber with a large stone, that was based on ropes and redirecting forces on logs. In my understanding, for a large pyramid, this is the only way that makes any sense at all, and it is quite a simple idea too.

The big problem the Egyptians had was with a different kind of engineering: hydrology and damming. They had dammed a local runnel of the Nile and were floating the rocks downstream on barges. Problem was, they didn't understand that half of a river's water flow is slowly through the mud and scree, not as the flowing water one sees. Their dams were vulnerable to this flow even though they'd stopped the visible "river" above ground. When the waterlogged mud moves, it tends to move in bursts -- which is how half of Alexandria turned into such a wonderful scuba -divers' attraction.


Every few years they would wake up and find that their several thousand tons of dike had hiked overnight. They'd find it half a mile downstream -- a mere flotsam decoration afloat a multi-million-ton gazump of the Earth shrugging underneath it.

The dolorite rock was indeed employed but not in the way we would think. Large tripods would hang the stones and a pendulum swings into the granite giving much more force when roughing out the trench in question. Also with a properly shaped dolorite stone the hanging stone could be used much like a battering ram against the granite face. This is labor intensive but a team of ten could reasonably expect to shape and extract one 40 ton block in 12 to 14 months. Certain acids will also erode granite with some degree of success. All conjecture but well worth investigation.

You honestly believe the incredible precision of the rocks in the pyramids were achieved by smashing rocks together? no way man, I absolutely disagree. The fact that there is no record of how they were built, when literally everything else about the history of egypt is written somewhere is very strange. I find the theory that the egyptians did not create the pyramids, but found and used them as tombs much later to be very interesting. The idea the great pyramid was built as a tomb is just very implausible. When compared to the valley of the kings where most pharoes are buried they are incredibly different. The pathways are small and narrow, the rooms are not even comparable in size, and there is no writing or records anywhere. On top of that no bodies have ever been found in the giza pyramid. And now we have scientific evidence that they focus electromagnetic energy, which is just another piece of evidence that they had a unique and advanced purpose.

How the pyramids of Egypt were possibly and most likely built:
The stones were shaped at or near the quarry and transported to the Pyramid site in this method :
An assortment of encasements from spherical to cylindrical, encased the block and interlocked into place around each block stone allowing the stone to roll. Certain attachments around the encasement would allow either fulcrums or rope attachments to ease movement and allow for tight corner turning with the least amount of men. Once the stone reached the top, the interlocking encasement was disassembled and the stone was leaned over and slid into place.
This technique would have eliminated the need for lifting devices or a massive ramp.
My theory is that most likely it would have been a spherical encasement allowing for tight cornering. This would be the most logical way to transport a large stone using the pyramid itself as the ramp.
So in essence the stones were rolled up the pyramid in a spherical encasement that was removed once the stone reached its destination and leaned and slid into place once atop the pyramid. This process was repeated all the way to the top.
I have not decided yet if the encasements were made of a metal alloy or limestone etc. If bronze was used it would have been melted down for chisel making and as such there would be no evidence of the spherical encasements.
If limestone was used it may have then been discarded and reused for other construction.
In conclusion the only way to deliver a square to the top of a Pyramid is to encase it in a Spherical interlocking encasement.

The ramp was then infilled as the workers retreated from the highest points. The anomolous thermal images are just the result of as slightly different density or composition of those infilled ramps.

Reading these comments makes me realize something.

The amount of time it takes to build such a large structure is literally impossible with just a sled, human hands, and a river and I'll tell you why...

Average age for Ancient Egyptians was give or take 25 years. THIS IS NOT COUNTING BIRTH DEATHS. How do we know? Well, scientists tell us most of the information but I can give examples. Women specifically never lived past 30 and men a little longer. Tutankhamen was a PHARAOH and he lived to 18... 18! The most well fed, well treated person in the entire civilization lived until 18. And you expect these "slaves" to do the same? Also the workers were super malnourished like it has been for thousands of years. The rulers have always gotten everything in the land and things that they either have a surplus of or they don't care for go down to the citizens. These workers were probably never going to be over 120 pounds, never actually weight trained, and most importantly were IN THEIR TEENS!

So what can we conclude about this? Well a couple things really. Even with hundreds thousands of people this task is impossible. Not only would all the people have to carry a 1-10 ton brick, but they would have to work the bricks from a far ass distance to do it, then transfer it over to the pyramid only to be lifted up. WHICH IS ALSO IMPOSSIBLE! Now no one can tell me with a straight face that 100 people who age about 15 and weigh less than 100 pounds would be able to lift lets say a 5 ton brick. Hell even a thousand cant do it. Reason why? Well 5 tons is 10,000 pounds right? Well if you look at the surface area of said brick, it actually isn't that large. I would say at max maybe 50 people could even be able to touch it all together with both hands let alone lift it. These guys are gonna be squating maybe 50-100 (MAYBE 100. THAT'S A STRETCH) at max.

So now, lets say that they flipped said stone. More reasonable, easier to do, makes sense. Well, lets assume this right. They can get 30 people to surround the stone to lift it. At max for flipping it should be half. With that, the weight is significantly less of a burden so it's overall easier and consumes less workers. The stone however is still 10k pounds and 15 workers can only pick up a total weight of maybe one thousand pounds all together. I'm giving the workers a little extra just to show how difficult this actually is. Well, they would still have to be able to "flip" 5k pounds which again, they won't even get it off the ground so it's still impossible.

So with this evidence alone, it's impossible to make a pyramid with their technology. Sad but true but I'm enjoying myself so I'll go on a bit...

So most theorists say the pyramids were built in 20 years. That means that 400 stones (I gave a little for an even number) would have to be set daily. Well, lets talk about the stone carvers or "hitters" since they hit the stones with rocks. It takes 1 hour to get 5mm down in one single spot. Now i would say that each stone would probably have maybe 2,000 spots? Basing this off of my current desk size and a spot being about 2 by 2 inches. With evening, the stone out completely and saying that each stone required maybe 30mm of work done on each spot, the number comes out quite large. 12,000 hours per brick. That is, and I am not joking about this, a year per stone. 12 hours a day at stone hitting and you get one fully shaped stone in 1 year... MY LORD I DIDN'T EVEN THINK IT WAS GONNA BE THAT BAD!

Well, unlucky Egyptians. Now of course you can probable have multiple Egyptians working on 1 stone but its still a significant amount of time for something so, simple. And it isn't even the hard part. So now you know how these things are actually impossible. Even by the 1-2 million people that lived at the time. It's quite insane when you look back on it and realize that, some people lived and died building the same pyramids never living past the age of 20. Depressing but true...

The hieroglyphs are symbolic depictions not always literal translations. When they show a tall person and a short person near each other, they are symbolising a tall person in stature and rank, not height (i.e. giants). Likewise, when they depict a man pouring a jug of water on sand, it does not mean that that was literally how it was done. It would have involved thousands of people pouring water. The symbol of one man pouring water just means that water was used by man to, etc, etc. To throw the word Aliens and say that is how it was built is simplistic and too lazy. Ok, if it was intelligent life from outer space, which is possible, then they and the stones and water and sand would still be subject to earth's gravity. So, pulling, cutting etc, would still need to be used. If you really believe that they would just shine a beam of light through their eyes or from their space craft to build, not just the Great Pyramids but ancient structures all over the world, then you are very nieve and misguided in your thinking. The clues are there in the pyramids, why overlook them. I personally go with the theory that they built from the top down. They used gravity to their advantage. Very difficult, even today, to move over 50 tonnes of stone up, but down is a different story. I struggle with the 20 year build theory, but there was no tv or internet back then, so no distractions for civilization. Moving stone by day and moonlight 24/7 is therefore possible. Remember too, that as you see things today, does not mean it looked like that thousands of years ago. The landscape would have been completely different. Don't get me wrong, there are many mysteries that are just mind scratching. How did they get the measurements, mathematics and alignnents so accurate and cut stone so precise - even today we cannot replicate in many examples of stone found. It sure would have been amazing to have a time lapse camera mounted to see these magnificent structures being built, wouldn't it? Anyway, thanks for reading. 4:30 It's so interesting that the ratio of the volume of the original pyramid to the volume of the frustum left by taking off the upper half is 8/7, therefore 87,5% of the original volume is in the lower half. So if it took two decades to built and the increase in difficulty when getting higher is neglected, then the lower half took 17,5 years and the upper half 2,5 years. If you consider a cone of height h (generalized pyramid) intersected by a plane parallel to the base and measure the distance y from the vertex on top to this plane in order to cut the cone in two half's of equal volume, you find h/y=∛2, i.e. the first half of the volume is in the first 20% of the height and the other half in the last 80%. If you do the same for equal lateral area then h/y=√2, so you find half the lateral area in the first 30% of the height and 70% in the last. Even when being aware of my tendency to underestimate and adjusting my guess accordingly, I was still way off. Building a pyramid is discouraging for much of its construction time and most of the observable progress in height is done in a comparably short amount of time!

I worked for an architectural firm for about 8 years. We decided one day on lunch break it would be fun to explore the practical side of how the Egyptian pyramids were built. We used our own project model process, dividing up the research and planning and actually, I think, solved every single problem associated with using the then available technology and materials. some of our engineers really came up with some very simple (surprisingly simple) solution and proved them practical with our pretty advanced engineering software. It was quite fun and I think I am part of the few people who have the whole solution as to "How they did it". It was not as mysterious and complex as people think. There was obviously no ramp. I was surprised to learn the stones came from a quarry using a technique used to this day- convenient to the way limestone is naturally layered. the stone were not actually 'cut" but they were broken out of their layers using simple techniques. This was confirmed by some in-depth existing geological surveys of the actual Egyptian quarry where the stones came from. I think a few problems such as the shaping of granite by the "dolerite" carving were left unanswered. No one in the firm believed such intricate detailed carving of red granite could have been done using that technique considering the time and manpower available to the project. All we could say was "It was done". But, actual moving, lifting and placing the stones was worked out with modern scheduling and planning software and we all were quite satisfied with the result. No "'wheels" were applied to the problems, just simple rope, sledges, levers and human power. But, our engineers were quite clever in the way those forces were applied. it was all pure intelligent technique, experience, application of materials in the proper way and muscles. with a large dose of motivation and devotion.

One thing that always upsets me when people try to figure out how the pyramids were built is that assertion that they carved out these huge blocks by smashing little rocks repeatedly into them. The time involved in that kind of a technique would absolutely preclude that possibility, as they would have required a gigantic army of people (far too many to fit in all the quarries in Aswan) to produce blocks fast enough to have built the pyramids in 20 years time.

I know it seems like a conspiracy theory to believe that they had technology more advanced than rocks and copper chisels, but the evidence seems quite clear. The Ancient Egyptians were way more advanced than we give them credit for. Consider how much weight these people placed on geometry, precision, craftsmanship. Their language is a lot more advanced than any other language at the time which we know of, and that hints at a vastly greater intelligence than we give them credit for.

The harsh conditions would also have destroyed most "soft" technology, like papyrus records or even string. There is a lot of advanced mathematics that one can do with nothing more than a straight edge and a string, actually, and their later obsession with measuring and dividing up lands into sections is well documented, and used no more advanced materials than chains and poles. They may have even had other "soft" technologies like this. Anything from glass blowing and electroplating of metals, to iron tools or basic wooden furniture, would not have survived to even the Middle Kingdom period unless it was hidden in a Tomb. We forget, the Ancient Egyptians were as distant from the Middle Kingdom as those people were to the Late Kingdom, who were just as ancient to the Ancient Greeks, who were again as ancient to the Ancient Romans, who in turn just as ancient to the Medieval period, who are just as distant in time from us. This is remarkably ancient stuff, here.

Basically, I'm not saying aliens did it. What I'm saying is that modern Egyptology has the Egyptians pegged all wrong.

How about the internal ramp theory of construction? In my opinion, this is a much more logical and practical way to build a pyramid. For those not familiar with the technique, search YouTube for "lexxtex 293" and watch the video with the pyramid thumbnail. Perhaps not all pyramids were built this way. The first two definitely were not (the step and bent). The red pyramid possibly was, but I would guess this was a new technique for the great pyramid. Maybe it was discontinued after that, idk. I've not seen any evidence that other pyramids were built in this manner. Not to say it doesn't exist, I just haven't looked. The great pyramid though, it was almost certainly built this way.

Also my theory about the slaves. I do believe slaves were involved in the construction. However, they were probably used only for the most basic labor. You have to remember the time in which the pyramids were built. Upper and lower Egypt were literally just united into one kingdom. The pyramids were national monuments, constructed to as a symbol to unite the peoples of the kingdom, and show the power, pride, and glory of the new nation. As well as, possibly, tombs. It is always curious to see claims that "we could not build something like that today" and base this claim on the fact that "modern cranes can not lift those weights". This would be a talk of a theorist whose only idea of building comes from observing modern building sites and the use of cranes there. Nothing bad in observing and drawing conclusions, but cranes are not the only way to build.

Depending on the surface, you only need a regular tractor and a proper sledge or wheeled cart to move big blocks of stone. Add slope to that surface and you could move the said blocks higher, thus being able to stack the blocks on top of each other. Add an exit ramp for the tractor and you could have a train of tractors mounting blocks on a pyramid. And so, with modern tools and enough financing you could quite easily build plenty of pyramids. Replace tractors with manpower, line the sledge skids with copper and you have roughly what they had in ancient times.

I also find it very curious to see skeptics say "the pyramids are built too precisely, humans could not do that with hand tools". It is as if the builders had to imagine the measurements and cut blindly, hoping the pieces fit. That is such a backwards thought that it boggles my mind. Anyone with any experience in construction knows that you do not measure every piece with a ruler, but you use templates for repeated processes.

It may be strange technology to some people today, but I am fairly certain that the Egyptians used simple wooden frames to help cut blocks to proper size. You can build a template from four wooden boards in minutes and when cutting a block, make measurements with it so the template fits vertically just through the block. With seven more boards you can make a horizontal arc-like template to measure and fit the height of the block. With these two simple templates you could produce any amount of practically identical blocks. You do not even necessarily need nails to make the templates, just a piece of rope for measuring and a saw to notch the boards, so they fit nicely and firmly.

And how do you make sure the blocks are aligned the right way on-site? You use... dramatic music... more wooden templates (with some rope)! You simply build templates that are aligned by the corners and sides of the floor below, so each new layer is angled and fit perfectly. This means that once you have the lowest floor well-measured, you can just keep on building on top of that with floor-templates. I would imagine they took control measurements while at it, since you do want to make sure the templates produce what you want.

Oh, about the rock: even some alien-theorists admit that limestone can be quarried with copper tools, so there is not much argument about the base material. But what about the granite then? Surely it was cut and delivered by aliens! Well, no. Just because the skeptics think that cutting rock with another rock is impossibly tedious and they could never imagine themselves capable of cutting a nice smooth surface with just a rock, it does not make it impossible for a talented craftsman to do it. The ancient Egyptians apparently also used blunt copper saws and sand to cut granite, which makes perfect sense considering their environment. Again, just because a skeptic himself can not imagine the setup of a cutting team with sawyers, sand-inserters, dust-removers, blade-fitters, repairmen, measurers and a host of other tasks involved, it would still make sense that the men back then came up with ways to make the process efficient.

And no, I have never built a pyramid but I have built other structures with basic tools. It is not hard to imagine that the Egyptians just scaled simple methods and produced something as awesome as the pyramids, if you let go of the perilous thought that just because you can not imagine how it happened, it could not have happened.

Great Pyramid is dated around 2,500BC and the heyday of pyramid building was all done by 1,700 BC. The Hyksos and chariots arrived in Egypt around 1650 BC. While it is possible that pyramids built 500 years after those in Giza used wheels and axles (which Semetic people had been using from about 2000 BC), Giza was made without wheels and axles. Note: The wheel is really unimpressive without the axle. Pottery wheels are much older than vehicles with wheels on axles. Lastly, the story of the Exodus is after the Hyksos invasion. Its disputed as to how long after, but even bible scholars place the timeframe as around 1500 BC, 100 years after the Hyksos rule in Egypt had begun. Again, ignore the wheel. A wheel is useless in terms of load bearing without an axle.

Here are all the major facts completely obliterating the mainstream theory:
- For the dynasty to work for the great pyramid it had to have been built in 20 years. If work was done on it 7 days a week 10 hours a day 365 days a year a stone had to be laid every 2 minutes. But the vast majority of the workers were farmers that could only work during the flooding of the nile, 3 months out of the year. Accounting for that, a stone had to be laid every few seconds, with an accuracy unparalleled in the modern world.- The great pyramid has a 13 acre base, using sattelite measures it was determined that the top of the pyramid is a quarter of an inch off the center of the base.
- Some stones weigh more than 40 tons, up to 135 feet high in the pyramid, placed with micron accuracy.- Copper doesn't cut granite, it is exactly like trying to cut aluminium with a lead saw (in fact worse than that). Sand is mostly quartz, so it could cut granite in theory, but the idea that you could cut 40 ton blocks like that and have them straignt with less than a milimiter deviation is just outrageous. Its as impossible as ingraving a microprocessor with a hammer and chisel made of cheese.- Where did all the wood needed come from ? According to the theory, it was imported from Europe (no straight face was attempted while typing that). There isn't a single piece of evidence for it.- Over a million hyeroglyph walls in Egypt telling us about every aspect of the lifes of those who supposedly built the pyramids: how they made love, how they went to the toilet, what they ate, everything. Not one of those walls describe or talk about or even simply says "we built the pyramids". Not a single hyeroglyph inside or on the pyramids either. Not even the name of the guy its supposed to burry.- Not a single mummy was found in the pyramids. Interesting fact since archeologists had to dynamite their way into the pyramid. Still, the official explanation for this is essentially ghost grave robbers.- When the ramses museum was built, they wanted to include the nearby granite statue, so they asked for it to be moved inside the building. The engeneers came back and said it had to be cut in 20 pieces to be moved, because it weighed in excess of 1000 tons. The largest landcrane on earth can lift 200 tons barely, from a boat to a dock. Thousands of years ago the egyptians were carrying 1000 ton solid pink granite objects hundreds of miles with ease. That's completely unexplainable without the use of advanced technology, we aren't even close to being able to do what they did. Instead the museum was built around it.

Some facts, for example, about the Great Pyramid:


***The Pyramid of Menkaure, the Pyramid of Khafre and the Great Pyramid of Khufu are precisely aligned with the Constellation of Orion.

***The interior temperature is constant and equals the average temperature of the earth, 20 Degrees Celsius (68 Degrees Fahrenheit).

***The outer mantle was composed of 144,000 casing stones, all of them highly polished and flat to an accuracy of 1/100th of an inch, about 100 inches thick and weighing approx. 15 tons each. We're talking of engineering and architecture only modern machinery has been able to imitate.

***The cornerstone foundations of the pyramid have ball and socket construction capable of dealing with heat expansion and earthquakes.

***The mortar used is of an unknown origin (Yes, no explanation given). It has been analyzed and its chemical composition is known but it can’t be reproduced. It is stronger than the stone and still holding up today.

***It was originally covered with casing stones (made of highly polished limestone). These casing stones reflected the sun’s light and made the pyramid shine like a jewel. They are no longer present being used by Arabs to build mosques after an earthquake in the 14th century loosened many of them. It has been calculated that the original pyramid with its casing stones would act like gigantic mirrors and reflect light so powerful that it would be visible from the moon as a shining star on earth. Appropriately, the ancient Egyptians called the Great Pyramid “Ikhet”, meaning the “Glorious Light”.

***Aligned True North: The Great Pyramid is the most accurately aligned structure in existence and faces true north with only 3/60th of a degree of error. The position of the North Pole moves over time and the pyramid was exactly aligned at one time.

***Center of Land Mass: The Great Pyramid is located at the center of the land mass of the earth. The east/west parallel that crosses the most land and the north/south meridian that crosses the most land intersect in two places on the earth, one in the ocean and the other at the Great Pyramid.

***The granite coffer in the “King’s Chamber” is too big to fit through the passages and so it must have been put in place during construction.

***The coffer was made out of a block of solid granite. This would have required bronze saws 8-9 ft. long set with teeth of sapphires. Hollowing out of the interior would require tubular drills of the same material applied with a tremendous vertical force.

***Microscopic analysis of the coffer reveals that it was made with a fixed point drill that used hard jewel bits and a drilling force of 2 tons.

***The Great Pyramid had a swivel door entrance at one time. Swivel doors were found in only two other pyramids: Khufu’s father and grandfather, Sneferu and Huni, respectively.

* It is reported that when the pyramid was first broken into that the swivel door, weighing some 20 tons, was so well balanced that it could be opened by pushing out from the inside with only minimal force, but when closed, was so perfect a fit that it could scarcely be detected and there was not enough crack or crevice around the edges to gain a grasp from the outside.

***With the mantle in place, the Great Pyramid could be seen from the mountains in Israel and probably the moon as well.

***The weight of the pyramid is estimated at 5,955,000 tons. Multiplied by 10^8 gives a reasonable estimate of the earth’s mass.

**Sun’s Radius: Twice the perimeter of the bottom of the granite coffer times 10^8 is the sun’s mean radius. [270.45378502 Pyramid Inches 10^8 = 427,316 miles]

***The curvature designed into the faces of the pyramid exactly matches the radius of the earth.

***Khufu’s pyramid, known as the great pyramid of Giza, is the oldest and largest, rising at 481 feet (146 meters). Archaeologists say it was the tallest structure in the world for about 3, 800 years.

***The relationship between Pi (p) and Phi (F) is expressed in the fundamental proportions of the Great Pyramid.

I took a history of architecture class at Texas A&M and one of the most plausible ways presented of raising the stones after transport was the idea of rocking the stone back and forth putting a shim under each side that is lifted and then rocking back the other way and shimming that side. you keep repeating that with enough shims you can lift the stone until it reaches the height of the layer you are building. The idea is like moving a refrigerator back tipping it and putting the weight on a side or corner and turning it to move it in place. As for the lifting location on the pyramid, you leave a stone protruding from the face to provide a flat surface to lift the stone to the work layer. If you stair step the protruding stone from each layer then you can continue to lift the stones up the full height of the pyramid, layer by layer. After the rough pyramid is built with the big stones then the finish stones are placed then the flat face is chiseled from the top down giving the flat finished surface. The gilded top of the pyramid would also be placed as you work your way down from the top.

I once saw a video on the "making" of the pyramids in college, and it was by far the most ludicrous method of building a pyramid I've ever seen. It was basically a scaled down version, with a limited number of men, the tools believed to be used, and nothing special to help them. These men included architects, as well as other craftsmen professions... and the only way they succeeded was by going way over the time budget, and by moving large quantities of dirt in order to complete the circular ramp JUST so they could move the top pieces in place.

According to the men who tried the recreation, they had no idea how it would have been possible to manage such a project, unless there was genuinely unlimited man power, and the amount of tools at hand were practically limitless, with even more people constantly sharpening they're very soft copper tools.

There are two obvious answers to this puzzle (Occam's Razor): either the Egyptians used a technique that modern man has long been unaware of (or has completely ignored), OR the Egyptians managed to somehow build them with an advanced engineering that we do not have today.

What sucks is that both those answers could pretty well be interchanged with the layman, and there is growing doubt that we are missing a technique used by much more primitive beings... who believed in extremely over-allegorical gods.

I'm willing to bet that many previous civilisations knew a lot more than we currently give them credit for, and that's regardless of the advancements in technology they used. I'd blame the insane amount of necessity placed on modern machines, but it always goes both ways.

Oh, Veritasium, my dear boy, I must offer a different theory as to how the great pyramids were built.  Living on the banks of the Nile for so long, the ancient Egyptians became master hydrologists.  I submit to you that water canals were used to build the pyramids.  Enclosed canals were used to float the block to the top layer, where enclosed ponds were used by small crane barges.  I have evidence to back up this theory.  In an underground pit near the great pyramid (Khufu's), a crane barge was found in amazingly very good condition (actually the best preserved ancient boat in human history)  It is actually now on display in the Egyptian solar boat museum.  The blocks were craned into place using men as the ballast to raise and lower the crane.  All they had to do to lift the block into place from the pond was walk from the front of the barge to the rear.  Easy, efficient, and quick.  You might want to look into it, it's fascinating.  If you are interested, I can direct you to where there are more plausible theories concerning how the blocks were quarried, how they were moved from Aswan to Giza, how they were shaped to their final shape (quickly and precisely) and how they were raised to the "working ponds" for final placement.

1. The Great Pyramid (known as that of Khufu/Cheops) contains no Pharaoh’s body, no treasure chamber, and no treasures. There is no indication that it ever has contained these things. The popular myth of the Pyramids being royal tombs is clearly nonsense. The tombs archaeology has accepted – those in the Valleys of the Kings and Queens –are obviously tombs, storehouses of the Pharaoh’s earthly riches, intricately prepared to ensure his survival in the next world. The Great Pyramid contains none of the obvious trappings of a tomb.

2. The only reason it is known as the Khufu/Cheops Pyramid at all is due to some Victorian graffiti! When Colonel Howard Vyse blasted his way into the Great Pyramid he was determined to make his name as an Egyptologist. He longed for nothing more than to make some monumental discovery which would make him famous. His disappointment at finding the Pyramid empty was too much for him to bear – it was his last season in Egypt – and in the dead of night it is said that he crept up into the ‘air shafts’ (known as ‘spirit stones’ to the Egyptians) above the King’s Chamber and daubed some hieroglyphs in red paint. The following morning he made his ‘discovery’ and subsequently earned his place in the history books as being the man who discovered the identity of the owner of the Great Pyramid!

It is worth mentioning in addition that the symbols he painted were not even accurate ones for the period in which the Pyramid was then believed to have been built. The symbol for ‘Ra’ – chief amongst the Egyptian gods at that time – was depicted wrongly. Now surely if an Egyptian had painted that symbol he would have got it right! Not to do so would have been a grave insult to the most highly respected and feared of the Egyptian pantheon.

3. The stone sarcophagus which is contained within the Great Pyramid is too large to have been brought into the chamber in which it stands. Many books on the subject of this particular anomaly either point blank ignore the question or state rather bizarrely that the sarcophagus must have been installed during the building process. Now, surely, to a civilisation as advanced as that of the Ancient Egyptians, this solution would have made no sense whatsoever. If the reason for making the sarcophagus – which incidentally shows no indication of ever having been occupied – larger than the doorway was to put off thieves, surely the subsequent sealing of the chamber with huge stone portcullis blocks, and the thorough blocking off of the Ascending Corridor which leads to the King’s Chamber by three enormous granite plugs, would have been sufficient. It is highly unlikely that the opportunistic thieves of Ancient Egypt would have taken the time to plough through that much solid rock just to get into a chamber which they must have known was empty of all riches. And if the chamber was completely barren and empty, why go to such great lengths to ensure that it wasn’t opened up ever again? What secrets does the so-called King’s Chamber hold?

4. Some visitors, including the great and fearless Emperor Napoleon himself, have experienced strange visions and environmental distortions whilst inside the Great Pyramid, particularly the King’s Chamber. In the 1930s, author Paul Brunton spent a night there and was assailed by visions of “a circle of hostile creatures” which he likened to “elemental creations, grotesque shapes, madmen, hulking and devilish apparitions”. Was this mere hallucination? In more recent times such ideas have been put down to the background radiation given off by the black granite of the chamber, but surely if it was that simple then everyone who visited the chamber would experience a similar thing, wouldn’t they?

Early experiments indicated that the King’s Chamber ‘spirit stones’ did seem to generate an electrical field which caused minor shock to at least one poor visitor drinking from a metal hip flask! It has been suggested that the Pyramid, because of its granite blocks, could transmit and receive radio and even microwave signals very well, and some believe that it gives off energy in an ‘emanating apex’ – this means that energy spirals off the top of the structure in a circle which widens as it permeates the atmosphere. Whilst some have seen this as mere New Age hokum, others have said this confirms their suspicions that the Pyramid is some kind of beacon intended for use from space.

More recently, ex-NASA consultant Richard Hoagland has stated that radioactive sand was found in a chamber behind the Queen’s Chamber, which might explain both the weird experiences of Napoleon et al, and the anomalous radioactive date readings given by the Pyramid -in which it appears that the top of the structure is 1000 years older than the bottom! This has led some people to speculate that the Pyramid was constructed upside down in mid air by alien technology and then swung over into place on the Giza Plateau. I could not possibly comment.

5. A road eight feet wide and four inches thick could be built from San Francisco to New York and put inside the Great Pyramid. It has also been speculated that a wall three feet high and one foot thick could be built all the way around France with the amount of stone it took to build the Great Pyramid. Its perimeter is almost 1 kilometre, and the inside area – a massive 53,000 square metres – would be able to incorporate the cathedrals of Florence, Milan and St Peter’s (The Vatican), as well as Westminster Abbey and St Paul’s. And this was accomplished by people of the Stone Age, yes?

6. They are the sole remnant of the Seven Wonders of the World. The Pyramids are also, apart from the Great Wall of China, the oldest surviving artificial structures on Earth.

7. There are no true hieroglyphic markings inside the Pyramids – remarkable for a nation which carved them into just about every available surface they had. Nor are there any real clues from hieroglyphs elsewhere as to how the Pyramids were built. The only hieroglyphs inside the Great Pyramid are the red paint daubings of Howard Vyse and are not genuine Ancient Egyptian carvings. Although Pyramids elsewhere in Egypt, most notably those of a much later date than the Pyramids at Giza, do contain hieroglyphs – the derivation of the so-called ‘Pyramid Texts’ – the Great Pyramid and its two companions of the Giza Plateau are untouched by the scribe’s knife.

8. As Giza Pyramid investigator August Tornquist states: “The Great Pyramid was the greatest single undertaking in the whole history of mankind. And yet there is not one picture or drawing, not one artefact, not one inventory or tally sheet to tell of its construction. The Egyptians left us some 3000 years of written and pictorial history covering virtually everything that happened in their culture. From babies being born, to ploughing and harvesting, building, weaving, sacrificing, praying, embalming… but nothing about the Pyramids of Giza. Why?”

For a nation that loved to boast, they seem strangely reticent to tell us anything about the Pyramids at Giza. Perhaps the reason was simply because they were as much a mystery to the Ancient Egyptians as they are to us.
There is in fact documentary evidence – from Sumerian clay tablets unearthed in the great historical library of Nineveh – that the Great Pyramid was known to the Sumerians of 10,000 years ago, 6000 years before the first Pharaoh of Egypt was even born!

9. It is built to face true North, supposedly at a time when such computations could not have been possible. Are we to believe that the Ancient Egyptians – on top of all their other wonders – were also the first civilisation to possess knowledge of mathematics so precise that they could determine true North from magnetic North? Come to that, are we to believe that they could even find magnetic North, or know what its significance was? Tied in with this idea of being able to locate true North is the notion that the Earth is round, a fact not generally accepted until the last few centuries. Some still dispute it even today!

10. The Great Pyramid is located at the exact centre of the Earth’s land mass. That is, its East-West axis corresponds to the longest land parallel across the Earth, passing through Africa, Asia, and America. Similarly, the longest land meridian on Earth, through Asia, Africa, Europe, and Antarctica, also passes right through the Pyramid. Since the Earth has enough land area to provide 3 billion possible building sites for the Pyramid, the odds of it having been built where it is are 1:3 billion. As previously discussed in my article on Anomalous Maps, the ability to compute longitude was not supposedly available to cartographers or anybody else until the 18th century. Without an understanding of longitude it would be exceptionally difficult to be able to pinpoint the size, shape, and relative mappings of the Earth’s land masses and seas. Without longitude it would have been near impossible to undertake major sea journeys, and yet if the evidence (such as Egyptian mummies containing cocaine traces) is reliable, the Egyptians did actually undertake such exploratory missions, even as far as South America (the only place the cocaine could have come from). (All this despite their apparent hatred of sailing on the open seas!) And even if we accept that the Egyptians of thousands of years ago were competent navigators, how could they have known about the exact interrelation of the rest of the Earth’s land mass? And then there are the statistics…

11. Like 20th century bridge designs, the Great Pyramid’s cornerstones have balls and sockets built into them. Several football fields long, the Pyramid is subject to movements of expansion and contraction from heat and cold, as well as earthquakes, settling, and other such phenomena. After 4,600 years its structure would have been significantly damaged without such construction. Recent construction experts called in to offer suggestions as to how the Pyramid could have been built make reference to the ‘settle factor’ of any large building. They have publicly stated that while the acceptable settle factor of a modern skyscraper is 6″ per hundred years, the simple fact is that the Pyramid – using more construction material than 35 Empire State Buildings – has settled less than 1/2″ in 5000 years! Modern construction has also averred that although for a large modern tower block the acceptable variance from complete alignment of all four sides is 6″, the four sides of the Pyramid are out of perfect alignment by less than 1/4″!

The casing stones, 144,000 in all, were so brilliant that they could literally be seen from the mountains of Israel hundreds of miles away. For those interested in possible symbolic significance, in Bible prophecy 144,000 is the number of people – 12,000 from each of the 12 tribes of Israel – who are supposed to evangelise the world in the days before the Apocalypse. The outside surface stones are cut within 0.01″ of perfectly straight and at nearly perfect right angles for all six sides. And they were placed together with a gap between them of only 0.02″. Modern technology cannot place such 20-ton stones with greater accuracy than those in the Pyramid. As already noted above, the variance from perfect alignment seen in the Pyramid is still something which is unattainable today.

What can we deduce from these facts? That whoever built the Pyramids used a technology that we still do not possess today to cut, move, and cement stones. Whoever built it also had some considerable knowledge of the Earth, because they were built in one of the few locations with a strong enough bedrock to support the great weight. The builders also knew where the greatest land mass of the Earth was in both the North-South and East-West directions. After studying the detailed measurements made by the investigators before him, Sir Isaac Newton (who was fascinated by the Pyramids) recognised that many key measurements would be in round numbers if the standard unit of measure was just 0.001″ (1/1,000) larger than the British inch – which just happens to be the Sacred Jewish Inch. (The Sacred Jewish Inch, 1/25 of a cubit, equals 1.00106 British inches.) This discovery allowed the secrets of the Pyramid to be unlocked and revealed unmistakable and mathematical relationships.

For instance: A – We know from geometry that there is a universal relationship between the diameter of a circle and its circumference. Consider this: The height of the Pyramid’s apex is 5,812.98″, and each side is 9,131″ from corner to corner (in a straight line). If the circumference of the Pyramid is divided by twice its height (the diameter of a circle is twice the radius), the result is 3.14159, which just happens to be pi. Incredibly, this calculation is accurate to six digits. So the Pyramid is a square circle, and thus pi was designed into it 4,600 years ago. Pi is demonstrated many times throughout the Pyramid.

B – Other numbers are also repeated throughout. Each of the Great Pyramid’s four walls, when measured as a straight line, are 9,131″, for a total of 36,524″. At first glance, this number may not seem significant, but move the decimal point over and you get 365.24. Modern science has shown us that the exact length of the solar year is 365.24 days.

C – The average height of land above sea level (Miami being low and the Himalayas being high), as can be measured only by modern-day satellites and computers, happens to be 5,449″. That is the exact height of the Pyramid.

D – All four sides of the Pyramid are very slightly and evenly bowed in, or concave. This effect, which cannot be detected by looking at the Pyramid from the ground, was discovered around 1940 by a pilot taking aerial photos to check certain measurements. As measured by today’s laser instruments, all of these perfectly cut and intentionally bowed stone blocks duplicate exactly the curvature of the earth. The radius of this bow is equal to the radius of the Earth. This radius of curvature is what Newton had long been seeking.

All this has led many to see the Pyramids (particularly the Great Pyramid) as being built by visitors from another planet, since the technology was obviously not such as would have been available to Stone Age Man. The theorists speculate that the Pyramid is a message, a symbol of knowledge which we as early humans learnt to decipher, and hence built our own versions of the Pyramid, examples of which litter the Egyptian desert plateau in crumbling ruins. This message indicates that whoever built the Pyramid knew the Earth well: the length of the year, the radius of curvature, the standard measurement techniques, the average height of the continents, and the centre of the land mass. They were able to construct something that we still cannot construct today, and they were able to tie all these things together in this single structure. Were they extraterrestrial, or perhaps even supernatural? Some people think so. You be the Judge.

قال تعالى : وَقَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ يَا أَيُّهَا الْمَلَأُ مَا عَلِمْتُ لَكُمْ مِنْ إِلَهٍ غَيْرِي فَأَوْقِدْ لِي يَا هَامَانُ عَلَى الطِّينِ فَاجْعَلْ لِي صَرْحًا لَعَلِّي أَطَّلِعُ إِلَى إِلَهِ مُوسَى وَإِنِّي لَأَظُنُّهُ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ [1] (سورة القصص، الآية 38).

استعمال الفراعنة الآجرّ في بناء الصروح: فقد طلب فرعون من هامان أن يبني له من الطين المحروق الأجر صرحاً، وهذا يعتبر من الإعجاز التاريخي للقرآن الكريم فقد ظل الاعتقاد السائد عند المؤرخين أن الآجر لم يظهر في مصر القديمة قبل العصر الروماني، والذي يرى في ذلك إشكالاً في أن الآيات السابقة التي تبين طلب فرعون من هامان أن يبني له صرحاً من الآجر أو الطين المحروق وظل هذا هو رأي المؤرخين إلى أن عثر عالم الآثار بتري على كمية من الآجر المحروق بنيت به قبور وأقيمت به بعضاً من أسس المنشآت، ترجع إلى عصور الفراعنة رمسيس الثاني ومرنبتاح وسيتي الثاني من الأسرة التاسعة عشر (1308 - 1184 ق.م) وكان عثوره عليها في موقع أثري غير بعيد من بي رعمسيس أو قنطير عاصمة فراعنة شرق الدلتا.
الإشارة إلى أحد أعوان فرعون باسمه هامان: ذكر موريس بوكاي ما نصه :[3] " يذكر القرآن الكريم شخصاً باسم هامان هو من حاشية فرعون، وقد طلب إليه هذا الأخير أن يبني صرحاً عالياً يسمح له، كما يقول ساخراً من موسى، أن يبلغ رب عقيدته. وأردت أن أعرف إن كان هذا الاسم يتصل باسم هيروغليفي من المحتمل أنه محفوظ في وثيقة من وثائق العصر الفرعوني، ولم أكن لأرضى بإجابة عن ذلك إلا إذا كان مصدرها رجلاً حجة فيما يخص اللغة الهيروغليفية وهو يعرف اللغة العربية الفصحى بشكل جيد، فطرحت السؤال على عالم المصريات وهو فرنسي يتوافر فيه الشرطان المذكوران تماماً. لقد كتبت أمامه اسم العلم العربي (أي هامان) ولكنني أحجمت عن إخبار مخاطبي بحقيقة النص المعني واكتفيت بإخباره أن هذا النص يعود تاريخه بشكل لا يقبل النقض إلى القرن السابع الميلادي. كان جوابه الأول أن هذا الأصل مستحيل، لأنه لا يمكن وجود نص يحتوي على اسم علم من اللغة الهيروغليفية وله جرس هيروغليفي ويعود إلى القرن السابع الميلادي وهو غير معروف لحد الآن والسبب أن اللغة الهيروغليفية نسيت منذ زمن بعيد جداً. بيد أنه نصحني بمراجعة كتاب "معجم أسماء الأشخاص في المملكة الجديدة" للمؤلف هرمان رانك ( Dictionary of Personal names of the New kingdom, by Hermann Ranke ) والبحث فيه إن كان هذا الاسم الذي يمثل عندي الهيروغليفية موجوداً فيه حقاً. لقد كان يُفترض ذلك، وعند البحث وجدته مسطوراً في هذا المعجم تماماً كما توقعته، ويا للمفاجأة!! ها أنا فضلاً عن ذلك أجد أن مهنته كما عُبر عنها باللغة الألمانية (رئيس عمال المقالع) ولكن دون إشارة إلى تاريخ الكتابة إلا أنها تعود إلى الإمبراطورية التي يقع فيه زمن موسى، وتشير المهنة المذكورة في الكتابة إلى أن المذكور كان مهتماً بالبناء مما يدعو إلى التفكير بالمقاربة التي يمكن إجراؤها بين الأمر الذي أصدره "فرعون" في القرآن وبين هذا التحديد في الكتابة.

Granite was not the material used on the outside of the pyramids at Giza.

Building materials for the Giza pyramids:
-Core: Nummulite limestone from quarries about 200-400m south of the pyramid.
-Casing: Light white limestone, so called Tura-limestone from quarries from the eastern shores of the Nile.
-King's chamber: Rose granite from Aswan 900km away.
-Further materials: Graywacke from the Wadi Hammamat (Eastern desert), basalt from the northern Faiyum.

actually i recently came across a theory that suggested the sphinx was not a sphinx (animal body, human head) at all at first, but rather a statue of Anubis, a god with a canine (jackal) head. this is supported by the proportions of the statue itself, currently the human head is much, much smaller than would be anatomically correct. furthermore Anubis is touted as guardian of the gates between worlds, an appropriate meaning for the statue\s position.

 it is suggested that as the statue weathered, the snout of the jackal was lost to the elements, as were the ears, and the face was reworked to resemble a human one - a fact validated by the condition of the rest of the statue, which is far more weathered currently than the human face, thus the latter is speculated to have been carved way more recently. 

 thought i share, because it was quite an interesting theory, at least to me. appropriate for a pyramid video as well :-)

It always amazes me that the wheel is considered one of the big inventions, and it surprises me even more that there were cultures who did not use wheels. I mean, I remember as a small child when we used to play with large rocks. It did not take us very long to figure out that the easiest way to move them was by trying to flip them over from side to side. This sounds like a commendable attempt to bridge current conventional scientific (dare I say scientistic) understanding with the truth of how these structures were created.

There is evidence available to suggest that the method by which the pyramids were built flies in the face of how we as a society today (at least "officially") believe history unfolded, with emphasis on the technological development of human society. When I see a video like this, it's like "let's try and explain how the pyramids were built given our unquestioning belief in conventional history".

When that happens, any evidence that would fly in the face of our conventional history isn't even entertained within the theory of how these were built. When do we dig deeper and try to answer the questions that don't stack up with conventional historical perspective...because maybe, just maybe, that perspective is seriously missing something?

Further to that, anyone who goes far out enough to suggest this (especially in the academic field) is effectively dismissed for reasons that amount to cognitive dissonance by the dismissers. In short, it is our beliefs that must bend to form theories that take hold of that discernible evidence, or we're just fooling ourselves for a little longer. Everyone has to make up their own minds about it in the end.

About the "ramp theory" discussed below, just ask an Engineer and he will tell you how absurd the idea is.  To maintain a reasonable slope to allow a heavy stone to be dragged up, the length of the ramp would have to be huge.  And what material would have they used for the ramp? Not sand for sure, that would not be stable enough.  The construction of the ramp would even be more challenging than the pyramids themselves.

The geopolymer theory (an artificial process of rock formation that was "rediscovered" and it is currently being used) makes a lots of sense and solves many of the engineering challenges of the construction.  One aspect in favor is that Egyptians had all the ingredients to "produce" the rock. However, the necessary alkaline activate necessary might have become rare due to intense exploration and the "technology" was lost in time.  

See the link that I added below. There is nothing magical or supernatural. It is plain chemistry and some common sense. Now, like all the theories, there are still gaps that require further explanation.

There have been some big breakthroughs in reverse-engineering the pyramid construction. At-least for the biggest one.
A) A series on internal tunnels have been discovered that were used to pull rocks up on a slope without having to build a giant external ramp.
B) Worn rocks were discovered that suggest a pulley/crane system was used, where the slope of the pyramid itself was used to hoist the heavier granite rocks up the side, The Counter-weight would slide down the one side of the pyramid as the cargo would slide up the other.

If slanted passageways were constructed within the pyramid as it was constructed, it would have allowed transporting stones without the need to build external ramps. I thought of the pyramids as a symbol of human ingenuity and engineering masterpiece until I gained a new perspective by reading John Milton's epic poem Paradise Lost. It touches on the pyramids as the world's biggest, most enduring symbol of humanity's vanity and materialistic nature, built by (then thought to be) slaves who would receive next to nothing in exchange for building a monument for someone else. The work itself isn't about the pyramids, but the one or two lines that mention them really gave me a different view.

Was it not proven that they used an internal ramp to move the stones up to the top? They would have built a ramp on all four sides of the pyramid to get started, then begin a ramp that circles the pyramid. If the ramp was not internal, then it would have been impossible to created a perfectly straight face on the outside wall. Those stones would have to be placed as you were going up, to maintain a perfect angle with the previous strip. There is a documentary on Youtube about this that uses old radar scans of the pyramid that shows how there is a continuous path along the side that has less density compared to the granite stones.

Actually, a few years ago, special tunnels were found in at least that great pyramid of Cheops. These tunnels are assumed to be the ramps which lead in a spiral from the ground to the top, meaning that these ramps are actually part of the pyramid's structure.

This actually makes sense in two ways. First, there is no temporary ramp you have to deconstruct during the final construction steps, reducing the time to complete the pyramid. This even makes it possible to build the outer walls while the ramp is still in use. Second, as the ramp tunnel is built directly under the outer walls and as there is no connection to the tomb tunnels, you don't have to worry about tomb raiders finding the entry to the ramp.

So there is a very convincing theory that has cropped up in the past ten years or so to explain the ramp problem. For one thing, there is a problem with the idea of external scaffolding, or dragging blocks up the side of the pyramid besides there being no evidence of that physical, textual, ectetera. They wouldn't have the ability to secure these ramps to the side of the pyramid, and if they could, they would risk deforming the shape both because of the difficulty in surveying the progress and the forces exerted by the blocks and teams on the ramps.

However new evidence has been gathered to help with this. A team of researchers were permitted by the Egyptian government to take ground penetrating radar equipment into the Great Pyramid to search for additional passages. They managed to discover several internal passages that had been blocked off, and made to look like regular walls, that together formed a spiral ramp from the base of the pyramid to the top of the grand staircase.

The grand staircase has also been noted by several other expeditions to have bizarre properties. For one thing, it is a disproportionately tall chamber compared to all the others. The top stair is extremely eroded, far more than the other stairs in the chamber. There are regular bore holes drilled into the surface of the staircase suggesting that there was some structure fixed into the chamber that was later removed. The floor of the chamber is infused with some kind of grease.

The working idea so far is that the grand staircase was used as a rudimentary elevator, and these blocked off passages were used to drag up the blocks without compromising the shape of the outside of the pyramid. This allowed the pyramid to stay structurally defined from start to finish, making it very for surveyors to monitor progress and make intelligent corrections. It also explains how they were able to build 80% of the pyramid.

Things to take in to account: 

1)  We have no idea for certain when the pyramids were built, by who, and for what purpose.  The theory they were tombs?  Well plenty of them have been found still close - but they never a found mummy in them.  It is just a theory, a guess, that they were tombs.  

2)  The Valley of the Kings:  The tombs stretch a long way under ground.  Hell, some are tiring to walk.  But, sounds trivial, but there is no carbon residue to say they used fires to light the inside.  They are dark with no natural light sources.  But they didn't use fire to build them, or to draw the hieroglyphs etc.  

After visiting, you can't help but feel we really have no idea, and they were way more advanced then we know.  I am not saying aliens, or some crazy hidden tech.  But just that the accuracy and ability of their work is way beyond what was around then.
